instruction: Sanjaya said: Sanjaya said: Seeing Arjuna full of compassion and very sorrowful, his eyes brimming with tears, Madhusudana spoke the following words.
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Supreme Lord said: My dear Arjuna, how has this delusion come upon you at this critical moment? It is not befitting a noble person, and it will not lead to heaven, but to infamy.

instruction: Sanjaya said: O Bharata, at that time, Krishna, smiling in the midst of both armies, spoke the following words to the grief-stricken Arjuna.
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: You are mourning for what is not worthy of grief, and yet you speak words of wisdom. The wise grieve neither for the living nor the dead.

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: What are the signs of one whose mind is steady in wisdom and who is immersed in samadhi? How does such a person speak, sit, and walk?
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Lord said: One who gives up all desires of the mind and remains satisfied in the self alone is said to be steady in wisdom.

instruction: Arjuna said: You seem to confuse my intellect with contradictory words. Tell me decisively what is better for me.
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: In this world, two paths were given by Me long ago 혰 the path of knowledge for the contemplative, and the path of action for the active.

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: Then what impels a person to sin, even unwillingly, as if by force, O Krishna?
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: It is desire, it is anger 혰 born of passion 혰 a great devourer, a great sinner. Know this as the enemy here.

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: O Krishna, you were born after Vivasvan; how then did you teach this science to him in the beginning?
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, long ago, I was born and I taught this science to Vivasvan. This is a truth, and I also remember all my past lives. But you do not remember, O scorcher of enemies!

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: O Krishna, you have praised renunciation of action (sannyasa) and also the performance of action (karma yoga). Tell me decisively which is better.
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: Renunciation of action (sannyasa) and the performance of action (karma yoga) both lead to liberation, but of the two, the performance of action is superior.

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: O Krishna, you have described the renunciation of actions as the best, and the performance of actions as inferior. But I see a contradiction in your words. Please clarify.
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: O Arjuna, a true yogi does not renounce actions but renounces attachment to them. He who works with attachment to the fruits of his actions, is far from liberation.

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: O Krishna, the mind is restless and difficult to control. How can a person whose mind is disturbed by desires practice yoga?
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: Undoubtedly, O mighty-armed, the mind is restless and difficult to control, but through constant practice and detachment, it can be controlled.

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: O Krishna, you have said that through practice and detachment, one can control the mind. But the mind is indeed very turbulent and difficult to control.
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: O Arjuna, the person who makes a sincere attempt, with unwavering faith and practice, will definitely attain perfection, even if they fail initially.

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: O Krishna, how can one who has made an effort in yoga but has failed, be born into a family that is noble and spiritually rich?
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: Those who have made sincere efforts in their past lives are always reborn into the best of circumstances, and they continue their journey towards liberation.

instruction: Arjuna said: Who is the Lord of sacrifice, and how does He reside in the body, O Madhusudana? And how can those engaged in devotion know You at the time of death?
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: The indestructible, transcendental living entity is called Brahman, and his eternal nature is called the self. Action, pertaining to the development of material bodies, is called karma.

instruction: Arjuna said: Tell me again in detail of Your power and glory, for I am never satisfied in hearing Your nectar-like words.
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: I shall now declare to you My divine glories, O best of the Kurus. There is no end to My manifestations, but I will tell you the most prominent ones.

instruction: Arjuna said: If You think I am capable of seeing it, O Lord of all yoga, then show me Your eternal form.
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: Behold, O Arjuna, My hundreds and thousands of divine forms, of various colors and shapes.

instruction: Arjuna said: You devour all the worlds with Your flaming mouths. You lick them up with blazing tongues. Your fierce radiance fills the universe, burning everything.
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: I am Time, the great destroyer of the worlds, and I have come here to destroy all people. Except for you, all the soldiers here on both sides will be slain.

instruction: Arjuna said: I desire to see You in Your four-armed form, with a crown, holding a mace and a discus. O Lord of a thousand arms, please appear in that form again.
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: Out of My grace, I have shown you this supreme form, radiant, universal, infinite, and primal, which none before you has ever seen.

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: O Janardana, seeing this gentle human form of Yours, I am now calm and restored to my own nature.
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: Very difficult it is to behold this form of Mine which you have seen; even the gods always long to see it.

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: Those devotees who always worship You with devotion, and those who worship the formless혰who among them is better versed in yoga?
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: Those who fix their minds on Me and worship Me always with steadfast faith, I consider them to be the most perfect in yoga.

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: O Krishna, I desire to understand Prakriti (nature) and Purusha (the spirit), the field and the knower of the field, and also knowledge and that which is to be known.
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: O Arjuna, this body is called the "field," and he who knows it is called the "knower of the field" by the wise.

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: By what signs is he known who has gone beyond the three gunas, O Lord? What is his conduct, and how does he go beyond these three gunas?
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: He who does not hate the appearance of light (Sattva), activity (Rajas), and delusion (Tamas), nor longs for them when they disappear;

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: O Krishna, what is the nature of those who perform acts of worship, but not according to the scriptures? Are they in Sattva, Rajas, or Tamas?
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: According to the three gunas, the faith of the embodied soul is of three kinds. It is in accordance with the nature of the individual; O Arjuna, hear how it is.

instruction: Arjuna said: Arjuna said: O Krishna, you have described the renunciation of action (Sannyasa) and the path of selfless action (Karma Yoga). Please clarify the difference between the two, and which is superior.
response: Lord Krishna replied: The Blessed Lord said: Renunciation (Sannyasa) and selfless action (Karma Yoga) are both paths to liberation, but one who performs selfless action is superior. Renunciation without action is not the ideal path.
